data.name: System Notes
data.what_it_is: AI-generated portfolio system built under a hackathon deadline as a constrained experiment
data.why_it_exists: To force shipment of a real portfolio site under an external deadline, avoiding indefinite delay due to UI avoidance, while exploring orchestration, authorship boundaries, and evaluation clarity
data.what_happened: Successfully shipped and deployed a real site; UI intentionally minimal, with AI included due to challenge focus rather than frontend interest

data.name: Delegate Action
data.what_it_is: Temporary AI coding agent implemented as a narrowly scoped GitHub Action
data.why_it_exists: To stand in for missing GitHub functionality: invoking a coding agent from within existing GitHub Actions workflows
data.what_happened: Enabled AI-generated pull requests for documentation updates using prompts defined in Awesome GitHub Copilot; intentionally scoped as disposable pending native GitHub support

data.name: Hermes Agent
data.what_it_is: Local AI agent playground for experimenting with memory, workflow learning, and agent behavior
data.why_it_exists: To design a locally grounded personal agent that adapts to specific workflows instead of relying on generic, stateless prompts
data.what_happened: Currently in design phase; serves as a conceptual and architectural sandbox rather than a completed implementation

data.name: RAI Lint
data.what_it_is: Commit linting tool that enforces explicit attribution of AI involvement in code authorship
data.why_it_exists: To make AI usage explicit and enforceable instead of implied and ignored
data.what_happened: Successfully normalized AI disclosure in commit history using commitlint and gitlint

data.name: Underfoot
data.what_it_is: AI-assisted travel planner focused on surfacing local context, constraints, and tradeoffs
data.why_it_exists: To explore AI orchestration and narrative synthesis using a real-world travel discovery problem
data.what_happened: Worked well initially, then over-extended past intended scope; became a lesson in timeboxing, versioning, and orchestration limits after hackathon tooling expired

data.name: Awesome GitHub Copilot
data.what_it_is: Personal collection of GitHub Copilot prompts, agents, instructions, and skills organized for reuse
data.why_it_exists: A place for GitHub Copilot tools and patterns that earned their keep instead of just sounding clever
data.what_happened: Functions as a living reference actively used in daily workflow to promote consistency and reuse

data.name: Dev.to Mirror
data.what_it_is: Automated publishing mirror that makes long-form technical writing visible to AI systems
data.why_it_exists: To make long-form technical writing legible to AI systems
data.what_happened: Solved AI visibility for Dev.to writing without self-hosting or moving the canonical source

data.name: Echo
data.what_it_is: Shared, opinionated ESLint configuration that encodes decisions once instead of renegotiating per project
data.why_it_exists: To provide AI strict, reusable formatting and linting constraints across projects
data.what_happened: Stabilized lint behavior and reduced bikeshedding and inconsistency across repositories

data.name: Copilot Chat Extension
data.what_it_is: Early experiment attempting to share Copilot prompts and instructions via chat
data.why_it_exists: To test whether Copilot chat context could persist across environments
data.what_happened: Proved unworkable due to lack of persistent context and documentation; abandoned rather than investing in a full plugin
